page.title: 16HOUSING
page.content: This area is quite an old area. Some of the houses and cottages are over five-hundred years old. Most of the old buildings are obviously toward the centre of the villages. Certain more recent road redevelopment has changed the aspect of Whatton, and there is now a distinct old village and a new one separated by a road. There has been little new development in Scarrington; what there is can be seen as individual buildings built at different times over the years. In Aslockton and Whatton, a number of small private and council housing estates have been developed firstly to serve the area as a dormitory village and later development because Nottinghamshire villages have become desirable places to live, for the more wealthy.
